aspecttable.name: WPRR-1971
aspecttable.reference: Signal definitions corresponding to pages 132-135 from the 1971 "Western Pacific Railroad Company - Operating Rules" binder. NOTE: Only aspects commonly used by WP in 1970's are listed.

revision.revremark: Initial version; dccAspect fields may not be correct.

aspect.name: Dark
aspect.indication: Stop; regard dark signal as displaying its most restrictive indication.
aspect.comment: Previous year operating rules had a specific rule covering dark signals, but that couldn't be found in the 1971 book.

aspect.name: Approach Medium
aspect.indication: Proceed, approaching next signal at medium speed.

aspect.name: Diverging Clear
aspect.indication: Proceed on diverging route. Observe prescribed speed through turnout.

aspect.name: Advance Approach
aspect.indication: Proceed, approaching next signal at prescribed turnout speed. Trains exceeding medium speed must at once reduce to that speed.

aspect.name: Approach
aspect.indication: Proceed, preparing to stop at next signal. Trains exceeding medium speed must at once reduce to that speed.

aspect.name: Diverging Approach
aspect.indication: Proceed on diverging route, approaching next signal prepared to stop. Observe prescribed speed through turnout.

aspect.name: Diverging Restricting
aspect.indication: Proceed on diverging route at restricted speed, except observe Rule 105 where applicable. Observe prescribed speed through turnout.

aspect.name: Restricting
aspect.indication: Proceed at yard speed in accordance with specific timetable instructions.

aspect.name: Restricting Diverging
aspect.indication: Proceed on diverging route at yard speed not exceeding 20mph, expecting tracks to be occupied. Observe prescribed speed through turnout. Speeds on sidings or auxiliary tracks will be governed by timetable instructions.

aspect.name: Stop And Proceed
aspect.indication: Stop; Then proceed at restricted speed.
